H0.text: The kittens are provided the same kind of milk from their mother as they grow, which explains why a litter of kittens have traits similar to both the mother cat and the father cat.

H1.text: The kittens inherit some of their traits from their mother and some from their father when a litter of kittens have traits similar to both the mother cat and the father cat.

H2.text: The kittens are kept at the same temperatures by their mother when they are first born, which best explains why a litter of kittens have traits that are similar to both the mother cat and the father cat.

H3.text: The kittens are taught by their parents to have similar traits, which explains why a litter of kittens have traits that are similar to both the mother cat and the father cat.

A4.text: When sperm and egg unite at fertilization, each contributes its allele, restoring the paired condition in the offspring.
